org.bytedeco.arrow_dataset

Class ScannerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.arrow_dataset.ScannerBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Namespace(value="arrow::dataset")
 @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=arrow_dataset.class)
public class ScannerBuilder
extends Pointer
    \brief ScannerBuilder is a factory class to construct a Scanner. It is used to pass information, notably a potential filter expression and a subset of columns to materialize.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer

    • Method Detail

      • FromRecordBatchReader

        @SharedPtr
 @ByVal
public static ScannerBuilder FromRecordBatchReader(@SharedPtr
                                                                        RecordBatchReader reader)
        \brief Make a scanner from a record batch reader. The resulting scanner can be scanned only once. This is intended to support writing data from streaming sources or other sources that can be iterated only once.

      • Project

        @ByVal
public Status Project(@ByVal
                              StringVector columns)
        \brief Set the subset of columns to materialize. Columns which are not referenced may not be read from fragments.
        Parameters:
        columns - [in] list of columns to project. Order and duplicates will be preserved.
        Returns:
        Failure if any column name does not exists in the dataset's Schema.

      • Project

        @ByVal
public Status Project(@StdVector
                              Expression exprs,
                              @ByVal
                              StringVector names)
        \brief Set expressions which will be evaluated to produce the materialized columns. Columns which are not referenced may not be read from fragments.
        Parameters:
        exprs - [in] expressions to evaluate to produce columns.
        names - [in] list of names for the resulting columns.
        Returns:
        Failure if any referenced column does not exists in the dataset's Schema.

      • Filter

        @ByVal
public Status Filter(@Const @ByRef
                             Expression filter)
        \brief Set the filter expression to return only rows matching the filter. The predicate will be passed down to Sources and corresponding Fragments to exploit predicate pushdown if possible using partition information or Fragment internal metadata, e.g. Parquet statistics. Columns which are not referenced may not be read from fragments.
        Parameters:
        filter - [in] expression to filter rows with.
        Returns:
        Failure if any referenced columns does not exist in the dataset's Schema.

      • UseThreads

        @ByVal
public Status UseThreads(@Cast(value="bool")
                                 boolean use_threads)
        \brief Indicate if the Scanner should make use of the available ThreadPool found in ScanOptions;

      • UseThreads

        @ByVal
public Status UseThreads()

      • FragmentReadahead

        @ByVal
public Status FragmentReadahead(int fragment_readahead)
        \brief Limit how many fragments the scanner will read at once Note: This is only enforced in "async" mode

      • UseAsync

        @ByVal
public Status UseAsync(@Cast(value="bool")
                               boolean use_async)
        \brief Indicate if the Scanner should run in experimental "async" mode This mode should have considerably better performance on high-latency or parallel filesystems but is still experimental

      • UseAsync

        @ByVal
public Status UseAsync()

      • BatchSize

        @ByVal
public Status BatchSize(@Cast(value="int64_t")
                                long batch_size)
        \brief Set the maximum number of rows per RecordBatch.
        Parameters:
        batch_size - [in] the maximum number of rows.
        Returns:
        An error if the number for batch is not greater than 0. This option provides a control limiting the memory owned by any RecordBatch.

      • Pool

        @ByVal
public Status Pool(MemoryPool pool)
        \brief Set the pool from which materialized and scanned arrays will be allocated.
